(2019): | demographics1_info5 = EUR 2,443 bn (EUR 20,707 per capita) |blank_name_sec2 = HDI (2019) |blank_info_sec2 = 0.907 · 3rd }} The Goriška Statistical Region or Gorizia Statistical Region () is a statistical region in western Slovenia, along the border with Italy. The region was created in 2005 for statistical purposes only. The western Julian Alps, the Soča river and the fertile Vipava Valley are the most recognizable natural geographic characteristics of the region.
